intro: Pringleochloa, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to sub-Saharan Africa and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plants typically grow in open, grassy areas and are adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions. Pringleochloa species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
